Plot: A pair of children, born within moments of India gaining independence from Britain, grow up in the country that is nothing like their parent's generation.
Title: Midnight's Children
Writer: Salman Rushdie (screenplay), Deepa Mehta, Salman Rushdie (based on a book by)
Actors: Rajat Kapoor, Vansh Bhardwaj, Anupam Kher, Neha Mahajan
tomatoConsensus: Though Midnight's Children is beautiful to look at and poignant in spots, its script is too indulgent and Deepa Mehta's direction, though ambitious, fails to bring the story together cohesively.
